channel.title: jira.namics.com
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3637] Movex IF-63: Verify Movex Product Attributes Import is working correctly
item.description:
Example: article 850841 / 11081010

  • there is no movex article for this product
  • presumably it has never arrived via IF-63 Movex Product Attributes, or it is a timing issue (IF-1 delta is imported after IF-63 delta)
    => please investigate
item.summary: Movex IF-63: Verify Movex Product Attributes Import is working correctly

comments.comment:
Matches in IF-01 files:
./erp_product-D1P271-20140324230141000.csv_20140324230213364:11081010;850841;1081010; ;US;14;DG; ; ; ; ;0002;PC; ;ZCON; ;20140324230013
./erp_product-D1P271-20140325230107000.csv_20140325230134717:11081010;850841;1081010; ;US;14;DG; ; ; ; ;0002;PC; ;ZCON; ;20140325230014

Matches in IF-63 files:
./mvx_product-D1P279-20140319231503000.csv_20140319231532003:11081010;850841;DAT;0;20140319231343
./mvx_product-D1P279-20140320231525000.csv_20140320231553982:11081010;850841;DAT;0;20140320231408
./mvx_product-D1P279-20140324231659000.csv_20140324231730988:11081010;850841;DAT;0;20140324231543
./mvx_product-D1P279-20140325231528000.csv_20140325231600598:11081010;850841;DAT;0;20140325231404

Data has arrived but there is a bug in the IF-63 import configuration that hinder the import. The IF-63 import last run successfully on 28.02.2014 (!).

Import configuration has been changed on 20.03. (v1.1.8.1) but did not run again.

The current problem looks like this:
{code}
24 Mar 2014 23:17:36 ERROR [ImpExWorker<1/3>] (000019TD) [MultiThreadedImpExImportReader] line 22 at main script: worker 1 got error pk has wrong format: 'CAT':For input string: "CAT"
de.hybris.platform.core.PK$PKException: pk has wrong format: 'CAT':For input string: "CAT"
        at de.hybris.platform.core.PK.parse(PK.java:457)
        at de.hybris.platform.impex.jalo.translators.ItemPKTranslator.convertToJalo(ItemPKTranslator.java:48)
        at de.hybris.platform.impex.jalo.translators.SingleValueTranslator.importValue(SingleValueTranslator.java:61)
        at de.hybris.platform.impex.jalo.header.StandardColumnDescriptor.importValue(StandardColumnDescriptor.java:480)
        at de.hybris.platform.impex.jalo.imp.DefaultValueLineTranslator.translateColumnValues(DefaultValueLineTranslator.java:162)
        at de.hybris.platform.impex.jalo.imp.DefaultImportProcessor.processUpdateLine(DefaultImportProcessor.java:536)
        at com.namics.distrelec.b2b.core.dataimport.processor.LastModifiedErpImportProcessor.processUpdateLine(LastModifiedErpImportProcessor.java:55)
        at de.hybris.platform.impex.jalo.imp.DefaultImportProcessor.processInsertUpdateLine(DefaultImportProcessor.java:376)
        at de.hybris.platform.impex.jalo.imp.DefaultImportProcessor.processItemData_Impl(DefaultImportProcessor.java:216)
        at de.hybris.platform.impex.jalo.imp.DefaultImportProcessor.processItemData(DefaultImportProcessor.java:121)
        at de.hybris.platform.impex.jalo.imp.MultiThreadedImportProcessor.processItemData(MultiThreadedImportProcessor.java:102)
        at de.hybris.platform.impex.jalo.imp.MultiThreadedImpExImportReader.processValueLineFromWorker(MultiThreadedImpExImportReader.java:487)
        at de.hybris.platform.impex.jalo.imp.ImpExWorker.perform(ImpExWorker.java:146)
        at de.hybris.platform.impex.jalo.imp.ImpExWorker.run(ImpExWorker.java:80)
        at de.hybris.platform.util.threadpool.PoolableThread.run(PoolableThread.java:198)
{code}

Going to fix it...
Fixed.
Verified on Q, Movex article now there, shippign cost calculated as expected.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3610] Pickup location: wrong name
item.description:
The pickup location is currently named
"Abholschalter Distrelec NewCo Switzerland"

It should actually be
"Abholschalter Distrelec Nänikon"
"Retrait chez Distrelec Nänikon"
"Pickup at Distrelec Nänikon"

comments.comment:
Change done in /distrelecB2Bcore/resources/distrelecB2Bcore/import/essential/common/erp-codelists_en.impex (and also de and fr).
I have changed it directly on the prod (see screenshot)
verified, looks fine

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3596] Login Page: "tab" key doesn't reach captcha field
item.description:
On the login page
https://test.distrelec.ch/login

After 3 unsuccessful login attempts, the captcha appears. The captcha field is skipped when going from field to field with the tab key.
item.summary: Login Page: "tab" key doesn't reach captcha field

comments.comment: Added "tabindex" to Captcha Module. Resolved.
verified, works fine now

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3595] Cart: don't show "+1" layer if product was added via direct order from within the cart
item.description:
Current situation:

  • when the user adds a product via direct order, the "+1" icon shows on the top of the page below the cart menu item
  • this is the only occurence. it doesn't show if a product is removed or if the quantity is changed.
  • it is not needed as visual feedback of the addition os already given

=> please remove the "+1" layer in this specific case.
item.summary: Cart: don't show "+1" layer if product was added via direct order from within the cart

comments.comment: Added "directOrder" to the list of actions that don't trigger an info popup. Resolved.
verified, works fine

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3594] Cart: Recalculate layer starts to jump if items are added via direct order
item.description:
Some issues with the recalculate button (appears after changes to cart):

  • On the bottom, the button stops too close to the edge (closer than on top)
  • if an item is added to the cart via direct order while the layer is already visible, the button starts to jump afterwards.
    • the more items you add, the further it jumps. basically it jumps over the combined distance of the added items.
    • on the lower end only
  • If more than one item is removed while the layer is already showing, the button will run over the bottom
item.summary: Cart: Recalculate layer starts to jump if items are added via direct order

comments.comment:
1) There is no difference between top and bottom, they have the same offset of 20px. However, if you have a screen that is very heigh, then the button won't reach the offset of 20px because it must always be vertically centered on your screen, under the condition that it stays inside the blue box. I increased the minimum offet to 60px so that the offset always is bigger than before.

2) Resolved. This was an issue because the sticky waypoint was not recalulated on cart change.

3) Resolved.
Hi Nando, would be great if you could test it again and see if it works for you.
looks fine now, thanks!

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3593] B2C My Account Edit Billing Address: Wrong property displayed
item.description:
• Log in as a B2C customer (nando.mueller+chp@gmail.com, distrelec)
  • my account -> addresses
  • edit billing address
    -> the title oft he form reads "Bearbeiten Sie Ihre Lieferadresse". It should refer to the Rechnungsadresse.

Does not occur for B2B. All other address edit forms in my account are ok.
item.summary: B2C My Account Edit Billing Address: Wrong property displayed

comments.comment:
In the accountAddEditAddressPage.jsp we check if the address was a shipping address. In this case, if we have an address who is shipping and billing we have the problem.
I have change it like this : b2CAddressForm.billingAddress ? 'billing' : 'shipping'
verified, looks fine

The customers should be able to import XLSX files as well.

what would the approximate effort of this enhancement be?
effort 2h: done!

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3577] Additional PIM fields to substitute #NEWLINE# tag
item.description:
I found a comment from Önder (on an already closed ticket, DISTRELEC-2649)...
@Florian: Are you aware of this? Shall I implement it?

Hallo, könnt ihr die Logik (#NEWLINE#) für die folgenden Attribute:

String ATTRIBUTE_CODE_FAMILY_DESCRIPTION = "5321";
String ATTRIBUTE_CODE_FAMILY_DESCRIPTION_BULLET = "5322";
String ATTRIBUTE_CODE_SERIES_DESCRIPTION = "5323";
String ATTRIBUTE_CODE_SERIES_DESCRIPTION_BULLET = "5324";

mit den folgenden Attribute erweitern:

String ATTRIBUTE_CODE_ARTICLE_DESCRIPTION = "5325";
String ATTRIBUTE_CODE_ARTICLE_DESCRIPTION_BULLET = "5326";
item.summary: Additional PIM fields to substitute #NEWLINE# tag

comments.comment:
I was not aware of this.
So yes please implement it.
@Önder: Can you please give me an example (product number), where the wrong behavior can be shown. So I have an example product to test the fix.

Hallo Adi, you can use this article: 850378/11072043
http://www.distrelec.ch/de/AirPlay-Outdoor-Lautsprecher---XW-SMA3-K%21%21%21/p/11072043

Current situation is different than described above. The following attributes may currently contain #NEWLINE# and will be splitted to bullet items:
- ATTRIBUTE_CODE_ARTICLE_DESCRIPTION_BULLET (5326)
- ATTRIBUTE_CODE_FAMILY_DESCRIPTION_BULLET (5322)
- ATTRIBUTE_CODE_SERIES_DESCRIPTION_BULLET (5324)

The new solution will additionally allow to have #NEWLINE# separators in the following attributes:
- ATTRIBUTE_CODE_ARTICLE_DESCRIPTION (5325)
- ATTRIBUTE_CODE_FAMILY_DESCRIPTION (5321)
- ATTRIBUTE_CODE_SERIES_DESCRIPTION (5323)

The changed behavior can be tested with the following article:
http://dev.distrelec.ch.distrelec.com/de/AirPlay-Outdoor-Lautsprecher---XW-SMA3-K/p/11072043
http://www.distrelec.ch/de/AirPlay-Outdoor-Lautsprecher---XW-SMA3-K/p/11072043

See accordion section "Produktinformationen".
Looking at it on Q the issue still seems to be there

Tested in DEV, where it worked fine.
Hashes of affected products still need to be removed. Created separate ticket for that: DISTRELEC-3653
Closing this one.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-2523] Increase session timeout
item.description:
Please increase the session time out to 4 hours, as per Florian.

From: "Buehler, Florian" <florian.buehler@distrelec.com>
Subject: Session Timeout
Date: 10. Dez. 2013 11:05:28 MEZ
To: Nando Müller (nando.mueller@namics.com) <nando.mueller@namics.com>

Hallo Nando

Session Timeout heute:

14400 Sekunden oder 4h

Kind regards

Florian Bühler
E-Platform Program Manager

comments.comment:
# /platform/project.properties
default.session.timeout=3600

# /distrelecB2Bstorefront/web/webroot/WEB-INF/web.xml
<session-config>
<!-- Session timeout of 30 minutes -->
<session-timeout>30</session-timeout>
</session-config>

# /platform/resources/advanced.properties

# session timeout check interval (in seconds)
# at most every X seconds the check for expired sessions will be called

session.timeout.checkinterval=60
according to René this tickets was postponed by Adrian.

Hallo Adi

Wann können/sollen wir das machen,
oder wie sollen wir vorgehen.

Danke
René

Please configure a timeout of 4h for tomcat and 4h30 for jalo session.
As a follow-up task, we have to check the memory consumption in AT production and extrapolate for CH. If calculation turn out a too large mem usage to hold session data, we have to reduce timeout duration again.

environment/common/hybris/config/local.properties

# The default session timeout (in seconds).
# If you specify 0 or less, the session will never timeout
# 16.1.2014 rha: set session timeout to 4.5 hours (16200 seconds)
# (web session timeout is set to 4 hours and jalo session should last longer)
default.session.timeout=16200

distrelecB2Bstorefront/web/webroot/WEB-INF/web.xml

<session-config>
<!-- Session timeout of x minutes -->
<session-timeout>240</session-timeout>
</session-config>

Memory used per session is too much. After launch, we hat more than 55'000 sessions on one single node. The "Old Gen" memory was completely sucked up by sessions.
With the current memory (8G => Old Gen is around 5.5GB) and application v1.1.4 we can serve hold around 40-50'000 sessions. They will consume around 4GB of memory in Old Gen.

Actions taken:
- send request to /ishop/... not to the CMS 404 page anymore, but return a 404 by Apache
- reduce session timeout to 3600 (Apache) and 3660 (+1min for hybris Jalo session)

Other opportunities:
- add more memory
- reduce session size (optimize caching of navigation?)

René will take an eye on memory consumption.

The memory consumption is stable at the moment.

With the current cache & session settings,
the systems are using a minimum of 3GB heap space an do a full garbage-collection every 15 minutes.

The systems do have around 5-6 GB of free RAM.
(min. free RAM should be 2-3 GB)

We have aprox. 3000 active sessions (jalo) per node.

http://10.191.20.14*:9001/hac/monitoring/sessions
I would recommend to increase the session timeout to 2 hours an check the memory consumption again.
Any further steps needed on this?
The timeout is set to one hour at the moment.

I suggest to increase cache size from 100'000 to 300'000 items at the same time. Let's change the values on 2 of 4 nodes to be able to compare the different settings for a couple of days.

Node1+2:
- rise timeout to 120min (tomecat) / 121min (hybris)
- rise cache size to 300'000 items

Node3+4:
- no change

Increasing the session timeout from 60min to 120min can be handled without any memory problem. Around 4000-5000 sessions will be created per hour (on every server). So we have to hold around 8000-10000 sessions.
=> If not really required I would suggest to not further increase the session timeout. 2hrs should be enough and is more than a common e-commerce platform's session timeout.

Increasing the cache size does currently not make much sense. With 100'000 items we reach a hit ratio of about 95%. After increasing cache size to 300'000 items the hit ratio increased only little to 96%. However, we have to find out why certain items are rather being cached. E.g. StockLevel, ProductFeature and DistSalesOrgProduct have a very poor hit ratio.
=> see DISTRELEC-2463
If you think 2hrs are not enough, please re-open the ticket and we will discuss the situation.
Discussed with Florian, 2hrs is ok.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3653] Remove Hashes of products with a #NEWLINE# tag
item.description:
The PIM import has been changed to correctly handle the #NEWLINE# tag: DISTRELEC-3577

In order for the change to take effect, the hashes of all affected products need to be removed so that they are imported again.
item.summary: Remove Hashes of products with a #NEWLINE# tag

comments.comment:
The following script will remove the hash tag for all products having a #NEWLINE# in a ProductFeature value.

UPDATE productslp
SET p_pimXmlHashLocalized = NULL
WHERE itempk IN
  (
  SELECT DISTINCT p_product
  FROM productfeatures
  WHERE p_stringvalue LIKE '%#NEWLINE#%'
  )
Post installation e-mail sent to Laurent/Francesco.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3641] Deploy v1.1.9 to Q @ HP
item.description: Deployment of v1.1.9 to the TEST system at HP on Wed 26.3.14 around noon

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3616] Payment info not created on some orders
item.description:
• For some orders, the "Payment Info" is not created on the hybris order.
  • If that happens, the payment mode cannot be correctly written to the Movex Order, which then receives the payment code "000".
  • Consequence:
    • Order history detail page runs into an error 500 (to be fixed with DISTRELEC-3539)
    • Movex does not process the order correctly, probably sends out an invoice (addressed in )

=> please analyze why the payment info was not correctly written on order 00003AOF
=> If due to missing info in the reply from EvoPayments: Could the payment info still be created with less info?
=> Is all the info of the reply from EvoPayments written to the transaction record correctly?
item.summary: Payment info not created on some orders

comments.comment:
It is not clear how this could happen.
The parameter from evo payments are correct.

I've added some logging in the CreditCardPaymentParamsStrategy.java.
If this happens again we will know more details.
Please reopen, if this happens again.

item.description:

0.006 to 0.0067
0.0006 to 0.00067

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3514] Sperrgut zuschlag
item.description: The product 341234 has in movex "Sperrgutzuschlag" but in the shop/hmc it is not. See attached mailflow.

comments.comment:
As per Florian:

Analysis done in Movex
- field is maintained correctly in moves for 341234
- matching of the code seems to be correct as well

=> analysis on shop side should be done

Analysis shows the following result:
- For article 341234 we receive the correct gbRegelung code (2) from Movex
- If an article with this code is in the cart, it should lead to bulk shipping (normal bulk shipping or express bulk shipping) with higher rates being calculated
- This calculation is actually done correctly -> OK

Issues:
- Bulky items are not declared or marked as such in the cart. This could be a valuable additional information
- The naming of the shipping options does not differ between bulk shippment and normal shippment (both for standard and express). The calculation of the higher rate is done correctly, but the customer doesn't really know.

Suggestions:
- Add a "Sperrgut" declaration on the affected line item(s) in the cart
- Assure that the naming of the shipping options is correct

Discussed with Florian:
- Assure that the naming of the shipping options for bulk shipping is correct and includes "Sperrgut"
-- Labels for normal bulk shipping: Sperrgut Versand / Bulk goods mail / Marchandises encombrantes par courrier
-- Labels for express bulk shipping: Sperrgut Express Versand / Bulk goods express mail / Marchandises encombrantes par courrier exprès
(bulk shpping methods only exist in CH so far)

Also found a problem in the calculation:
- the bulk shipping rate is not 14.- (normal bulk), but actually it should be the normal shipping rate (12.40, 9.25 or free) PLUS 14.-
- similar for express bulk: it's 22.- PLUS 14.-

The prio should be:
1) If there is at least one freight item in the cart -> the freight shipping costs should apply
2) If there is no freight but at least one bulk item in the cart -> the bulk shipping costs should apply
3) If there are no freight and no bulk items in the cart -> normal shipping costs should apply

Also see here:
https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/G104+Delivery+Option+Management+%28BO-11%29

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3488] IT // Missing orders in Movex

klar, danke für dein Feedback.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3262] Ceckbox isn't checkable
item.description:
-Open https://test.a.distrelec.it/register/b2b in IE 9 with a zoom of 85%
-scroll down like in the printscreen
-try to check and uncheck the checkbox for "I accept the Data protection"
-> you will not be able to check/uncheck the checkbox

comments.comment:
Mark,
if the attached screenshot is the correct one I'm confused. The checkbox is checked, that suggests it works ? In IE8 I could not reproduce it.

Hey Nando,
the screenshot is correct.
Please be sure your zoom level is set to 85% and the checkbox is on the same line as the two buttons("Support" and "Feedback") at the bottom of the page.
Still cannot reproduce

Occurs in IE9 only, and only if the checkbox is on the same level as the feedback/suport tabs.
Low prio, for elfa.

This is not a problem just on this page, and not only in IE9 but also in Chrome. Nor is it necessary to zoom to 85%. Any links or checkboxes below the top of the Support and Feedback buttons are inactive. This is because these buttons are placed inside a full-widht statically positioned div, which obscures the underlying content. A simple change of z-index doesn't seem to help, a larger re-design of the page rendering may be necessary.

Dominic,
please advise on the best approach on this
Was a problem in every browser. Resolved.
tested 27.03.2014 on test.distrelec.ch and it's still the same problem...

can't confirm, tested it in chrome and IE8, both worked fine.
Mark, which browser have you used? Have you tried to empty the cache?

item.title: [DISTRELEC-2194] 8.2 Events --> Refactoring needed (functional testing failing so far)
item.description:
Compare e.g.: test.distrelec.ch or http://test.distrelec.ch/de/LED-Stromversorger-60-W-Mean-Well-PLC-60-12/p/11025504

Given: 'activatedEvents' : ['add_products', 'add-cdo', 'acc-att', 'req-hbr', 'add-nsl', 'add-ltc', 'blk-afl', 'blk-acl', 'blk-asl', 'add-ltc', 'blk-rsl', 'cart', 'download', 'list', 'cart', 'compare', 'favorite', 'list', 'print', 'share', 'sup', 'fdb', 'nlt'],

--> So far no tracking-requests are transmitted (except for 'add_products') by click on the specified events (compare Spec p. 17)

  • OS: W7
  • UA: FF 25.0
item.summary: 8.2 Events --> Refactoring needed (functional testing failing so far)

comments.comment: Sieht mir eher nach FE issue aus.

Hi Dominic

* Event 'cart' --> on product detail sites missing as second request (e.g. compare http://test.distrelec.ch/en/Windows-7-Home-Premium-ita-Vollversion-1-Microsoft-GFC-00142/p/11062288)

* toolsitem.skin.shopping-bulk ('list'): So far not working

* shoppinglist-add-to-cart ('add-ltc'): So far not working

Thx Mark
Info: only marks comment is still open. the issues described in the ticket are resolved.

1) Event Cart: This event is already implemented and only needs to be activated. But it is only implemented on the Toolsitem Cart Button (the icon one with the 8 corners) and not on normal Buttons. This means on the Product Detail View, a Click on "Zum Warenkorb hinzufügen..." does not trigger an 8.2 Event.

2) There was a bug which is now resolved.

3) Should already trigger an Event, see the attached Screenshot showing the two requests.
See comment, just call me if you think its easier to discuss over the phone.

4) Regarding 'Event Cart' (-> referring to 'toolsitem.skin.cart'):

--> In terms of Toolsitem Cart Button (the icon one with the 8 corners) the additional event is e.g. not triggered so far for 'Meta HD Flyout Search'

5) Generally please implement the additional event also for normal Buttons (Suche Global, Product Detail View, Meta HD Flyout Search, Compare View, BOM Manager, Shopping Lists)

6) Event 'Shopping Lists /shopping' (-> referring to 'shoppinglist-meta-actions'): So far not working

Thx Mark
4) Added 8.2 Event Tracking to Meta HD Suggest. Resolved.
6) Cannot reproduce. Was the event that maybe not activated? If the issue is still there, please describe it in more detail.

5)

Implemented:

√ Product Detail View (Buying Section)
√ Meta HD Flyout Search (Same as in 4)
√ Compare View
√ BOM Manager (Add to Cart und Add to List Buttons)

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

Not Implemented:

- Suche Global

Please define Tracking ID and which Button exactly should be tracked.

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

Was already implemented:

- Shopping Lists

Please define Tracking ID and which Button exactly should be tracked.

5) Okay (as discussed on phone: 'Suche Global' = 'Meta HD Flyout Search')

6) Event 'Shopping Lists /shopping': Event is activated and executed. However, the request is so far not poperly (aborted) transmitted. I have shortly looked into this: It seems that a pagereload is generated onclick. Question: Is 'sendunload' accordingly considered for the event?

Thx Mark
6) Okay. Which Event do you mean? "Add a new Shopping List" or "Add all Items to Cart" or another one?

6) The event 'Add a new Shopping List' is meant.

Mark

6) The problem here is the same as in another ticket: The event is fired, but not completely because of the following page load. The specification said, that sendOnUnload would make this possible, bis it does not work. As far as I know, we do not habe the possibility to track this event.

Hi Mark

Please see my latest comment. Unfortunately, I think this can not be tracked. But you could check back with your Webtrekk Contact and ask him, if he knows a solution to track something by Javascript with an immediate page load.

Please compare E-Mail dated Montag, 3. Februar 2014 09:09

Ciao Dominic
 
Danke für dein Feedback bezüglich DISTRELEC-2648 bzw. -2194.
 
Wie von dir erwähnt werde ich das gerne umgehend mit unserer Ansprechperson bei Webtrekk anschauen. Ich habe mir dazu den Quellcode (base-Js) angeschaut. Könntest du mir bitte kurz angeben, auf welche Js-Funktion sich z.B. die Klasse 'btn btn-primary' (bezieht sich auf den Fall 'req-snd') bezieht?

Ciao Mark

The best way to see this issue is in the form-feedback module. Suche dazu im File "http://www.distrelec.at/_ui/all/cache/base.js" einfach mal nach "Tc.Module.FormFeedback". Dort passiert nach einem Klick auf den Absenden Button folgendes:

1) sendForm() wird aufgerufen
2) sentFormSuccessful() wird aufgerufen
3) trackEventFormSent wird aufgerufen
3) webtrekkEvent wird gefeuert, was "onWebtrekkEvent" aufruft im Modul "Tc.Module.Webtrekk"
4) wt.sendinfo(webtrekkObj) wird aufgerufen

Diese Details musst du aus meiner Sicht aber gar nicht so genau verstehen. Wichtig wäre nur zu wissen, ob man einen Tracking Event auslösen kann, wenn danach ein PageLoad folgt. Aus meiner Sicht geht das eben nicht.

Move Implementation to on site link.

Rename onWebtrekkOnSiteLink to onWebtrekkEventWithPageLoad in webtrekk.js. Only used in newsletter subscribe so far.

Even if I put the following code directly into the HTML of the Newsletter Subscribe Button, the Request does not seem to be transmitted. You can try and add this via Firebug into the Markup on test.distrelec.at and see it for yourself.

onclick="wt.sendinfo({linkId:'ch.ons.test.-',sendOnUnload:1});"

Hi Dominic

As far as I know Webtrekk Js-functionalities need to be fully and properly initialised during page-loading. That is why a Markup-test within is not working in this regard via Firebug 'from scratch'.

A analogous working example (onclick-event Webtrekk function-call) you can find as following: https://www.distrelec.ch/home (click on promobox - compare attached screenshot).

For an according Hybris-testing please setup a 'onclick="wt.sendinfo({linkId:'ch.ons.test.-',sendOnUnload:1});"'-example on a test-environment (test-page) in order to test the Webtrekk-behaviour on the basis of a givne page-load.

Thx Mark

Hi Mark
Okay good to know, but I already tested this and I tested it now again putting the following link tag in the JSP:

<a href="https://distrelec-ch.local:9002/my-account" onclick="wt.sendinfo({linkId:'ch.ons.test.-',sendOnUnload:1});">Test</a>

I also tried the one from the current Distrelec Homepage Promo Teaser. There must be another issue. Is maybe a certain plugin not activated or included in the webtrekk v3 Javascript file?

Hi Dominic

I have created an according test-link on Q-environment (http://test.distrelec.ch/de//cms/Technische%20Informationen). Seems to work (compare attached screenshot)

Bests, Mark

Only visible in a traffic sniffer like fiddler.

Todo with Mark: Define affected Module and theri Link ID, see https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/Webtrekk+-+Frontend+Implementation "Events with Page Loads (ehemals Onsite Links)"

See Table "Events with Page Loads (ehemals Onsite Links)", I added every Module thats needs this.

+ Add ID, check that it is a "WithPageLoad" Event
+ Check via Fiddler Sniffer if Values are transmitted
All "Events Link Tags mit name Attribut on Page Load" Impelmented and Tested with Traffic Sniffer.

Hi Dominic

The fix-version v0.5. is noted. Howevere this must have been deployed later on. Is that checked-in respectively foreseen for deployment (FYI: not contained in the 1.1.6 Q-deployment according to release notes)?

Thx Mark

Hi Mark

This is already deployed on http://test.distrelec.at

Hi Dominic

Testing done on test.distrelec.at respectively last item on test.distrelec.ch:

* sup: WT-request not transmitted in Chrome (thinkable reason: name-attribute before href-tag -> compare attached screenshot) / please submit 'sup-sup' in this case (as specified in the WT-Spec)

* fdb: WT-request not transmitted in Chrome (thinkable reason: name-attribute before href-tag -> compare attached screenshot) / please submit 'fdb-fdb' in this case (as specified in the WT-Spec)

* fdb-snd: Could not test that successfully. Please verify.

* srh-snd: Could not test that successfully. Please verify.

* spa-spa | spa-snd: Could not test successfully. Please verify (tested via http://test.distrelec.at/de/DET4TC2-%2B-KIT%2C-spieslose-Erdungspr%C3%BCfung-Megger---1000-404/p/serviceplus/90040788)

* req-hbr | req-snd: Tested 'req-hbr' successfully. Could not test 'req-snd' successfully - please verify (http://test.distrelec.ch/de/Laborkabel-%C3%B8-4-mm-rot-100-cm-Multi-Contact-SML-100cm-red/p/14022002)

Mark

Hi Mark

I only tested the first one "sup" with my traffic sniffer and could see the request after clicking on the Button "Support". I attached a Screenshot.

Don't you see it in your Traffic Sniffer?

Regarding 'sup':

* Seems to work with IE and FF

* With Chrome the request seems not to be transmitted. On similar implementations (e.g. Footer-Links) it is yet working. Thereby the name-attribute is however after the href-tag. In order to get 'sup' also in Chrome to work I assume that the name-attribute needs to be placed after the href-tag.

Mark

It also already works in Chrome, but I changed the attribute order anyway.

I tested all those event IDs with my Traffic Sniffer and in my opinion they are all working.

Hi Dominic

E.g. 'fdb-snd' (to be transmitted on successful transmission of the feedback-form) I have also tested privately (no corporate traffic restrictions) on test.distrelec.at. The according request containing the ID seems not to be transmitted. Could you please attach a screenshot of the according Traffic-Sniffer request showing the request respectively the stated ID?

The support-'process' seems to be '2-step' by now. Is 'sup-snd' also implemented?

Thx Mark

1. Der Event heisst fdk-snd und nicht fdb-snd. Soll ich ihn umbenennen in fdb-snd? The event is sent locally on my machine but not on test.distrelec.ch. I am investigating the issue...

2. Support Process is implemented as one step. I will add the second step. Which ID should be used?

Hi Dominic

1. Sorry my mistake (mistyping) -> fdk-snd is correct

2. ID. sup-snd

Thx Mark

Hi Mark

1) Ok

2) Ok, I added this event.

I investigated why you could not see every event on test.distrelec.at. You have to add these events to the list of activated events via HMC. I added fdk-snd and sup-snd to test.distrelec.at and now you should be able to see those too. I attached you a Screenshot.

Ticket resolved.

Hi Dominic

I have tested the implementation on test.distrelec.at. Some findings:

* Support 1st step: Current: sup -> Required: sup-sup

* Support 2nd step (http://test.distrelec.at/de/Support/cms/support): Request containing 'sup-snd' is not transmitted on successful form-transmission.

* Feedback 1st step: Current: fdb -> Required: fdb-fdb

* Feedback 2nd step (http://test.distrelec.at/de/Feedback/cms/feedback): Request containing 'fdb-snd' is not transmitted on successful form-transmission. Request is however transmitted if captcha is entered wrongly. To be refactored.

-> Pleae verify for all according events on test.distrelec.at and refactor accordingly.

Thx Mark
